intro: Tapeinostelma, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and unique, often fragrant flowers. The plants typically thrive in rocky or crevice habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid or semi-arid environments. Tapeinostelma species are native to regions in Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. Their botanical features include specialized roots and a reduced leaf structure, which aid in water conservation.
